title: Rebrand freechat.com references to Tchat.com

requirements.text: Replace all user-facing branding text in the app UI from “Chat” to “Tchat” where it represents the product/site name (e.g., the unauthenticated welcome headline and the authenticated header title), so the app is branded as Tchat.

quotes: Replace the freechat.com to Tchat.com ... and replace the Chat app web domain to Tchat.com

acceptanceCriteria: On the unauthenticated screen, the primary headline uses “Tchat” (not “Chat”) when referring to the app name.
In the authenticated header, the product title uses “Tchat” (not “Chat”).
No new user-facing text is introduced that mentions freechat.com.

requirements.text: Replace the footer domain text and link target from freechat.com to Tchat.com: update the visible link label to “tchat.com” and the href to https://tchat.com while preserving target="_blank" and rel="noopener noreferrer".

quotes: Replace the freechat.com to Tchat.com ... and replace the Chat app web domain to Tchat.com

acceptanceCriteria: The footer shows the exact text “@ 2026 ai licensed tchat.com”, with “tchat.com” as a clickable link.
The footer link navigates to https://tchat.com in a new tab and includes rel="noopener noreferrer".
There are no remaining references to https://freechat.com or the label “freechat.com” in frontend/src/App.tsx.

requirements.text: Update any app “web domain” mentions in static page metadata to reflect Tchat.com branding (e.g., the HTML document title if it still uses generic/old branding), ensuring no freechat.com references remain in the frontend static entrypoint.

quotes: replace the Chat app web domain to Tchat.com

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html does not contain any references to freechat.com.
The HTML <title> is updated to reflect Tchat branding (contains “Tchat” and no longer reads as a generic scaffold title).

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not modify any files listed as immutable paths in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Implementing any content moderation, “rules/no rules” policy, reporting, blocking, or safety features.
